section.title: Authenticate against an Identity endpoint
section.para: To authenticate against the Identity v2.0 endpoint, instantiate a keystoneclient.v_20.client.Client object:
section.programlisting: from os import environ as env import keystoneclient.v2_0.client as ksclient keystone = ksclient.Client(auth_url=env['OS_AUTH_URL'], username=env['OS_USERNAME'], password=env['OS_PASSWORD'], tenant_name=env['OS_TENANT_NAME'], region_name=env['OS_REGION_NAME'])
section.para: After you instantiate a Client object, you can retrieve the token by accessing its auth_token attribute object:
section.programlisting: import keystoneclient.v2_0.client as ksclient keystone = ksclient.Client(...) print keystone.auth_token
